author: Staff Reporter
text:
The district administration has proposed to give permission to conduct jallikattu in three villages, provided all the safety aspects and other guidelines as prescribed by the Supreme Court are followed.

Meeting

Following the revoking of ban on jallikattu by the Centre, Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy chaired a review meeting recently in which officials from Revenue, Police, Animal Husbandry, Health, Public Works and Fire and Rescue Services departments participated.

He said that as per Section 3 (2) (IV) of Tamil Nadu Regulation of Jallikattu Act, 2009, three places were already notified by the district administration and the sport should be conducted only in those places.

The places were Alanganatham and Pottireddipatti where the sport can be conducted in January and in Devarayapuram in February.

Inspection

All the three places were located in Sendamangalam block and the festival committee members should submit proper applications and deposit amount to the administration. A team led by Namakkal Revenue Divisional Officer would inspect the places and decide on giving permission to conduct the sport, the Collector said.

The Collector said that the guidelines issued by the Centre including certification of the bull by the veterinarians, bull taming should be conducted within a radial distance of 15 metres from where the bull is let out and provisions given in Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960 should be adhered to.

The Collector said that in case of major sport event, a sum of Rs. 5 lakh and for minor event, Rs. 2 lakh should be deposited along with the applications.
title: Jallikattu to be conducted in three villages
